result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Trentadue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay child support obligations in compliance with child support order. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Shane R Trentadue in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Shane R Trentadue in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 11-17-2014/tk
The State is Ch. 950 compliant. Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The Court is also in receipt of disciplinary dispositions for the defendant from the jail.
The State agreed to follow the recommendation, which is a combination of prison and probation.

Def- req adj
BTC:  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
PRETRIAL SCREENING REPORT
Preliminary hearing on May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shane R Trentadue in court with attorney Michelle M Anderson.  Defendant Shane R Trentadue in custody.  James D Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. WARRANT VACATED.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
